qas.question: What kinds of telecommunications were cut?
What capabilities were cut to the entire Sichuan area?
How long did it take for these capabilities to be restored?
What was cut after the earthquake?
Who restored communications over a period of months?
What internet services were decreased in the area?
What services were finally online again?

context: Immediately after the earthquake event, <a0_0>mobile and terrestrial<a0_0/> <a3_0>telecommunications<a3_0/> were cut to the affected and surrounding area, with all <a1_0>internet<a1_0/> capabilities cut to the <a4_0>Sichuan area<a4_0/> too. Elements of telecommunications were restored by <a5_0>the government<a5_0/> piece by piece over the next number of <a2_0>months<a2_0/> as the situation in the Sichuan province gradually improved. Eventually, a handful of <a7_0>major <a6_0>news and media<a7_0/> websites<a6_0/> were made accessible online in the region, albeit with dramatically pared back webpages.
